name: Exclusive Bus for ENM 2025: Trip from Porto to Albufeira!
description:
Hello, summer-loving souls!â˜€ï¸

Erasmus National Meeting 2025 (ENM 2025) is just around the corner and, with that, ESN Porto is here to make sure your journey to Algarve is as good as you can get! Embark on a seamless adventure by joining us in our  exclusive and comfortable bus trip, tailored just for you.ğŸšŒ

Our round-trip bus ticket will transport you from the vibrant center of Porto to the heart of Algarve in Albufeira, and back. These tickets are exclusively available to those registered for the Erasmus National Meeting 2025. 

You wonâ€™t have to worry about your itinerary, since our bus takes us straight from Trindade Station to Muthu Oura Praia Hotel and back!ğŸ–ï¸

What's included:

  • Bus-trip: PORTO (Trindade) - ALBUFEIRA (Muthu Oura Praia Hotel), 24/04 - 01h30
  • Bus-trip: ALBUFEIRA (Muthu Oura Praia Hotel) - PORTO (Trindade), 27/04 - 14h

Price: 50â‚¬

Don't miss the chance to make your ENM experience seamless from start to finish. 

Secure your spot on the bus now and let the countdown to an epic adventure begin!ğŸŒ´

Notes:

The trip will only be able to go ahead if we have enough participants. If you're interested, be sure to book your spot soon so we can make it happen!

Refunds are available until 1 week before the event. For a refund, you need to send an email to refunds@esnporto.org. Your spot is only secured after you have paid for it!

ESN welcomes everyone! We hope to see you there soon! ğŸ’™

Yours in adventure,

 ESN PortoğŸŒŠ

name: Erasmus National Meeting 20th Edition
description:
ğŸ‘‡ REGISTER HEREğŸ‘‡ 

ENM TICKETS  

The biggest International Students event in Portugal is here; you donâ€™t want to miss it!ğŸ˜

Imagine you could go on a trip with around 500 International Students from across Portugal for 4 days at the beach, laying under the sun and experiencing what Algarve has to offer!

ğŸ‘‡ REGISTER HEREğŸ‘‡ 

ENM TICKETS 

OBS1. You will need to make a deposit of 25â‚¬ which will add to the fee. After all the rooms are checked, you will receive the deposit if no damage was done to the your room.

OBS2. Please make sure you check the refund rules with your local section - in any case after the 10th of April, no refund will be accepted.

OBS3. The rooms are made for 4 people. Some have 4 individual beds, others have 2 individual beds and 1 couples bed.

It is extremely important that you read the Liability Agreement  , only by accepting it can you participate. 

It is mandatory to have an ESNcard in order to sign up for this event, you can get yours here: http://www.esnportugal.org/get-your-esncard

Embrace yourself for the best trip of your Erasmus experience and sign up!

Should you have any questions, please contact your local section or ESN Portugal at ESNPortugal_events

name: ESN by Night: Reggaeton Edition
description:
ENGLISH

ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company!

name: ESN by Night
description:
ENGLISH

ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company!

Small Beer - 1â‚¬

name: ESN by Night
description:
ENGLISH

ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company!

Drink Prices:

Small Beer - 1â‚¬

Large Beer - 2,5â‚¬

Sangria - 2,5â‚¬

Somersby - 2â‚¬

Shots - 1â‚¬

What: ESN by Night

When: 24th of March 2025

Where: Galerias de Paris

Price: Free!

Notes:

You are automatically registered to this activity when you click "Buy".

Terrain: ğŸ’š Green:  The event is indoors.

name: ESN by Night
description:
ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company!

name: ESN by Night
description:
ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company! 

Drink Prices: 

  • Small Beer - 1â‚¬
  • Large Beer - 2,5â‚¬
  • Sangria - 2,5â‚¬
  • Somersby - 2â‚¬
  • Shots - 1â‚¬

What: ESN by Night

When: 10th of February of 2025 at 10:30pm

Where: Galeria de Paris (map here) 

Price: Free!

name: ESN by Night: Welcome to Porto
description:
The ESN by Night is a weekly event designed for our international students to socialize, have fun, and make unforgettable memories. Taking place every Monday night, this event brings together students from all over the world in a lively and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you are new to the city or have been here for a while, ESN by Night is the perfect opportunity to meet new people, share experiences, and enjoy a night out with a diverse and vibrant community.

Each week, the event features a variety of exciting activities! No matter the theme, the goal is always the same: to create a fun and inclusive space where students can relax and unwind after a long day of studies. In addition, attendees can enjoy special student prices on drinks, making the night even more enjoyable without worrying about breaking the budget.

Whether you want to dance, compete in games, or simply chat with friends over drinks, ESN by Night is the ultimate way to kickstart your week. This event is all about connecting people and embracing the international experience. So, gather your friends, bring your best energy, and join us every Monday for a night full of fun and great company! 

Drink Prices:  

  • Small Beer - 1â‚¬
  • Large Beer - 2,5â‚¬
  • Sangria - 2,5â‚¬
  • Somersby - 2â‚¬
  • Shots - 1â‚¬

Also, if our team wins during the ENG (Erasmus National Games) youâ€™ll have the chance to represent Portugal during the International Erasmus Games (IEG) which will be held in Italy.

But what should you know about what we'll be seeing?ğŸ¤”

GuimarÃ£es Castle - this castle is older than Portugal itself! It was built in the 10th century to defend the kingdom against the invasion of the Muslims. The castle was greatly strengthened in the 13th century, which is what you see today.

PaÃ§o dos Duques - Built by the eighth Count of Barcelos, the PaÃ§o dos Duques is a majestic mansion. It was built between the years 1420 and 1433. Today itâ€™s a museum where the decorative pieces are designed to create the illusion that visitors are entering an inhabited house.

Serra da Penha - In the historic center you can see a hill of more than 600 meters. It consists of more than 60 hectares of green area. Here you can enjoy a wonderful panoramic view that stretches to the ocean.

description:

Summerâ€™s winding down, but weâ€™re not ready to let it go without one last splash!ğŸ’¦

So, letâ€™s make the most of it with an epic Pool Party to welcome you to our beautiful city! Whether youâ€™ve just landed in Porto or youâ€™ve been enjoying this amazing city for a while, this is your chance to soak up the sun, make new friends, and create unforgettable memories! The idea is simple: a day of pure fun, relaxation, and connection. We want to give you a taste of the Portuguese summer lifestyleâ€”relaxed, joyful, and full of good company. â˜€ï¸

This pool party is the perfect opportunity for all international students to come together, whether you're here for study, work, or just exploring a new part of the world, to enjoy the amazing community that we're building here in Porto. So, leave your worries behind, bring your best summer vibes, and get ready for a day packed with fun, and fantastic company!ğŸ˜

description:

17th of September of 2024

To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. Hello curious minds about Portuguese culture!

 

Here is your chance to get to know more about Portuguese traditions! And how to do it in a better way than with good music, food and friends? Get on board! 

 

This is a night where you have the chance to discover more about the soul of Portugal, FADO, which is also a part of UNESCOâ€™s Cultural Heritage. The Fado's group of ISEP will accompany you during all night, while you have a taste of some typical portuguese food, like Bifanas, Moelas, RojÃµes, Caldo Verde (soup), different types of cheeses and Vinho do Porto (Port Wine) obviously! Beside this, other drinks are included such as water, juices and other wines (white and red).

If you are vegetarian, donâ€™t worry! You will be able to participate in this amazing night as we have an alternative option for you, that includes Vegetable Quiche, Ratatouille and Chickpea Salad. 

 

Ready to join us in this amazing adventure and dive into Portuguese culture?  ğŸ·

name: Farewell Dinner
description:
Hello, dear Erasmus friends,

Unfortunately, everything that is good comes to an endâ€¦ but we can still make it as memorable as all the moments we had together this semester ğŸ’™

In our farewell dinner, we gather to celebrate not only the end of an incredible journey but also the beginning of lifelong friendships and cherished memories.

During the time here in Porto, you had the opportunity to experience the warmth and hospitality of the Portuguese people, the stunning views along the Douro River, and the vibrant culture that makes this city so special. From exploring historic sites, to enjoying delicious local cuisine and partying with your ESNers, each moment has added to the richness of this Erasmus experience.

As we sit together in the magnificent ImpÃ©rio, let's take a moment to celebrate on the bonds we've formed, in a night full of surprises! ğŸ‘€

description:
Hey adventurers! Ready to explore?

Weâ€™re offering you the chance to visit one of Portugal's most stunning natural treasures! Letâ€™s venture to a magical place with jaw-dropping views, diverse flora and fauna, natural wonders, and so much more...
Join us on our trip to Peniche and Berlengas!! 

The Berlengas Archipelago consists of small islands 10 to 15 kilometers off Peniche, recognized as a World Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO since 2011.
Peniche is known as Portugalâ€™s surf capital, celebrated for its beautiful beaches and excellent surfing spots. 

Prepare to uncover the hidden wonders of the islands - unique landscapes and secret caves -, enjoy a spectacular view of the Atlantic Ocean from Cabo Carvoeiro, visit the stunning NazarÃ© where the worldâ€™s biggest wave was recorded, or simply take a dip in the clear blue waters!

name: Careoke
description:
Hello, our amateur and non-amateur singers!

Prepare your vocal cords for an unforgettable night of music, laughter, and a touch of linguistic confusion. We proudly present to you our much-anticipated event: "Careoke Night"! Now, before you start questioning our spelling skills, let us assure you â€“ there's a method to our linguistic madness.

Why "Careoke" you ask? Because it's not just about hitting those high notes; it's about hitting the high notes of compassion. This isn't your ordinary karaoke night; it's a night where every note you sing resonates with care and kindness.

We invite each and every one of you to bring a non-perishable food item â€“ a small gesture that will make a huge difference. Let's turn our passion for karaoke into a harmonious symphony of generosity! We will be donating all of the items to a charity organization that will be announced later on, once we find a suitable partner, so you can know where your items will be going to!

Don't miss out on the chance to sing your heart out for a good cause. See you at "Careoke Night" â€“ where every song has a purpose and every voice makes a difference!

When: Thursday, 23rd of May, 22:00

Where: Embaixada do Porto

Price: Free with non-perishable food item

description:

Prepare yourselves for an exhilarating voyage as we set sail to explore the enchanting wonders of Croatia!

In this captivating showcase, we invite you to immerse yourselves in the awesome Croatian culture, narrated by our very own Croatian students. From the sun-kissed shores of the Adriatic Sea to the historic cobblestone streets of Dubrovnik, let us unveil the hidden gems and cherished traditions that define the heart and soul of Croatia.

Indulge your senses in the tantalizing flavors of Croatian cuisine prepared with love by our Croatian friends. ğŸ²

Join us as we delve into the rich tapestry of Croatian history and heritage, from the ancient Roman ruins of Split to the majestic medieval architecture of Zagreb. ğŸ°

This excursion promises a rejuvenating experience, allowing you to unwind, soak in the crisp, invigorating air that's a rare find amidst the urban hustle, and acquaint yourself with the natural wonders that grace the outskirts of our beloved Porto. ğŸ’

To embark on this journey, make sure to arm yourself with a Z4 ticket for your Andante card or use your monthly pass if it encompasses the Valongo area. With transportation sorted, all that's left is to answer the call of the wild and discover the untamed beauty that awaits us! 

So, grab your gear, lace up your hiking boots, and prepare for an adventure that will leave you awe-inspired and connected to the serene majesty of nature.ğŸ¥¾ğŸ¥¾

name: Trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva
description:
Hey there, adventurers!

If you're looking for a breathtaking and unforgettable outdoor adventure through nature, then a trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva hiking trail is an absolute must!

Located in one of the five UNESCO Global Geoparks in Portugal, in Arouca, Aveiro, PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is a network of walkways that stretches over more than 8 km along the banks of the Paiva river.

As we make our way along the walkways, we will have a chance to admire the stunning views of the river and the surrounding mountains, as well as numerous waterfalls and other wonders of nature, where we hope to go ahead and refresh ourselves! :)

But this hike is not only about the scenery. Along the way, you'll also encounter a variety of fauna and flora, including rare and endangered species that are native to the region. So, are you ready to discover the amazing landscapes along the Paiva river?


Check out the program:

8:30 Meeting Point â€“ Trindade (we leave Porto)

11:00 Arrival at PassadiÃ§os do Paiva

11:15 Free time at the beach

12:30 Trekking (beginning) until the middle beach 

13:30 Time for lunch 

15:00 Trekking until the end 

17:00 Free time to chill out in a relaxed garden

18:00 Departure from PassadiÃ§os do Paiva 

20:00 Arrival in Porto

What: PassadiÃ§os do Paiva (Paiva Walkways)

When:  Saturday, April 20th, 8:30

Where: Trindade (map here)

Price: 14â‚¬

What to bring: Comfortable clothes and shoes, bathing suit, enough food for the day, water, a towel, sunscreen, your ESNcard, and lots of motivation!


What is included:

  • Entrance in PassadiÃ§os do Paiva
  • Transportation from Porto to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva


Notes:

Your spot is only secured after you have paid for it!

This event is inaccessible to people with reduced mobility!

Location: â¤ï¸ Red: It is a challenging hike that requires some physical effort to complete.

Terrain: â¤ï¸ Red: It is outdoors. The walkways have a lot of stairs. 

 

See you soon,

name: [New] Trip to Braga
description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 20â‚¬, with our Welcome Kit included (T-shirt, totebag, cup and cup holder ribbon, survival kit) it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. You must bring a photo of yourself (passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your ESNcard.


Hello, fellow travellers!
Are you ready to embark on a journey to the oldest city of Portugal? 

Begin your exploration at SÃ© de Braga, an awe-inspiring cathedral showcasing centuries of architectural marvels. Dive into a dynamic city tour, discovering the hidden gems of Braga's medieval streets.

Get ready to immerse yourself in Bragaâ€™s rich history as we visit iconic landmarks, learn about its fascinating past and visit this city with beautiful flower gardens and churches, that will make you want to update your Instagram! 

The adventure continues with a visit to Sameiro, offering breathtaking views, and Bom Jesus do Monte, a pilgrimage site with a grand staircase and stunning landscapes. 

Conclude the day on a picnic, with the most amazing landscape to Braga with your newly Erasmus friends. Plus, youâ€™ll get to try some new typical pastries: Frigideiras and TÃ­bias are two of the most famous ones.

name: Trip to Coimbra
description:
ğŸšŒ Hey there, travelers! Are you ready for your next adventure? Get ready to embark on a journey that blends rich history with vibrant student traditions in the heart of Portugal!

If you love to explore and have a good time, this trip is just right for you. Coimbra, nestled among Portugal's beautiful scenery, calls out to you with its mix of ancient charm and lively student vibe, earning its reputation as "the city of students."

ğŸ›ï¸ Step Back in Time at RuÃ­nas de Conimbriga: Let's kick off our expedition by delving into the remnants of ancient Roman civilization. Explore the ruins of Conimbriga, an archaeological marvel that transports you back to the era of the Roman Empire. Unearth centuries-old memories and immerse yourself in the allure of antiquity.

ğŸ“š Embrace Academic Excellence at the University of Coimbra: Our journey continues to the prestigious University of Coimbra, Portugal's oldest and Europe's illustrious academic institution. Marvel at the architectural wonders of PaÃ§o das Escolas, a UNESCO World Heritage site steeped in regal history since the days of King Afonso Henriques. 

And don't miss the chance to wander through the hallowed halls of Biblioteca Joanina, a masterpiece of Baroque architecture and home to a treasure trove of knowledge.

Whether you're a history buff, a culture enthusiast, or simply looking for an exciting escape, Coimbra has something for you. Join us on this immersive adventure and discover the magic of this extraordinary city! ğŸŒâœˆï¸

name: Trip to Aveiro
description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here,
after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It

yourself (passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your
ESNcard.

Greetings fellow travel enthusiasts!

Are you ready to explore a city brimming with traditional charm, vibrant buildings, and delectable sweets? Prepare for an unforgettable journey to Aveiro, often referred to as the Portuguese Venice! â›µ

Aveiro invites you to embark on an enchanting adventure aboard "Moliceiros," traditional boats that gracefully glide through the town's picturesque canals, offering stunning views. The city's captivating art nouveau-style buildings will capture your attention, encouraging you to take tons of pictures with your friends. ğŸ“·

In this romantic city thereâ€™s also a traditional sweet called â€œOvos-Molesâ€ and on this trip you will be able to not just eat them but to actually learn how to make them! These sweets are made from egg yolks and sugar, they have shapes of clams, barrels, fish and they are delicious! ğŸ¤¤

Concluding our marvelous journey, we'll venture to the charming fisherman's village of "Costa Nova," renowned for its iconic striped houses. The picturesque surroundings will beckon you to capture countless memories through your lens. Finally, you'll have leisure time to unwind on the sandy beaches of Costa Nova. â›±ï¸

So, are you ready to immerse yourself in the magic of Aveiro with us? Let the adventure begin!

This is our program:

08h30: Meeting point at Trindade (map here)

10h00: Arrival to Aveiro

10h30-12h30 - Boat trip/Ovos Moles Workshop

12h30: Free time for lunch and visit Aveiro

14h00-16h00: City Tour

16h00: Visit to Costa Nova Village and beach

18h00: Departure to Porto

Hey there, fabulous folks stepping into the vibrant world of Porto!

Get your game faces on because the Quiz Night - Porto Edition is about to kick off, and trust us, you don't want to miss this!

Picture this: A night filled with laughter, brainy banter, and maybe a victory dance or two. We're talking about a quiz that covers it all â€“ history, geography, arts, music, sports, and, of course, a special round dedicated exclusively to Porto, your newfound haven of awesomeness!

Whether you're a walking encyclopedia or just happen to possess an uncanny knack for quirky quizzes, this is YOUR moment to shine brighter than the city lights reflecting off the Douro River.

And hold on to your seats because there's a cherry on top â€“ top teams will be walking away with some seriously cool prizes. Yes, you read that right â€“ prizes!

Grab your squad of brainiacs (4 or 5 members, to be precise) and gear up for a night of intellectual exhilaration. No squad? No problem! ESN Porto has your back â€“ we'll hook you up with a fantastic group of potential new besties.

First of all, welcome to Port(o)gal!

New in town? Don't know many people yet? Not sure where to start? ESN Porto can help you out.

Picture yourself on a weekend with other Erasmus students, games and parties with nature all around youâ€¦ Starting to sound good, right?  So, we present to you: The Erasmus Camp! 

This weekend will be all about getting to know your fellow Erasmus colleagues and your favorite ESNers! We will have lots of games, activities and time to chill for everyone to get to know each other.

But first, where is this all going to happen?! Our weekend will be spent in SÃ£o Pedro do Sul. The perfect place for our weekend: surrounded by nature but also with a bunch of places to have fun.

During these 2 days we are going to have a lot of activities, games and a chill time for everyone to get to know each other! We are talking about:

  • Ice breaking games.
  • Cool activities and contests.
  • A whole new family (literally).
  • (Un)forgettable warm up and party.
  • Some contact with Mother Nature doing trekking.

name: Trip to Vigo
description:
Hello, fellow Christmas enthusiasts!

As autumn's golden leaves fall and a chilly breeze sweeps through the air, we stand at the beginning of the most wonderful season of the year. For those who cherish Christmas, we're excited to invite you on an enchanting day trip to the captivating city of Vigo in Spain. This coastal city transforms into a  winter wonderland during the holiday season.

During the day, you'll have the opportunity to explore "Castro's Fortress," delving into a rich era of history and culture. 

As night falls, the Christmas Market awaits to make your taste buds will delighted by  the traditional Christmas sweets and treats. You can also enjoy a thrilling ride on an enormous Ferris wheel, offering panoramic views of the city now enchanted by the magic of Christmas.

Don't miss this enchanted journey! Secure your spot now and immerse yourself in the festive charm of Vigo during the most wonderful time of the year! ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸âœ¨ğŸ„ğŸğŸ…


This is how we planned the day:

8:15- Departure from Porto

12:20- City Tour

13:15- Free time + Lunch Time 

15h-Visit to â€œCastroâ€™s Fortressâ€ (park + castle with a view to the city)

16:30- Visit to the Christmas Market 

21:30- Departure from Vigo

1:00 am - Arrival to Porto (Trindade + Polo UniversitÃ¡rio)

Hello dear soon to be healthy (but only after your Erasmus) ones,

In the context of the Social Impact Days, ESN Porto decided to create a space where you can listen and talk to captivating voices on topics concerning Mental and Physical Health.

Thatâ€™s right, we proudly present to you â€œLetâ€™s Talk About Healthâ€, an event where specialists will hold speeches about interesting topics in their respective areas, in a format close to that of a TedTalk (but better).

To give you the right amount of healthy energy we'll have a Zumba Class before anything else, and two coffee breaks during the day. To smooth the mood we'll need to groove, and for that we'll have two amazing artists playing and singing for us!

Finally, if you'd like to learn and discuss health along with your fav ESNers and experts in Mental Health, Sports and Nutrition, in a fun and chill environment, join us and Letâ€™s Talk About Health!

name: [Error] Trip to Ã“bidos
description:
Greetings fellow adventurers,


With the festive season just around the corner, we're thrilled to announce a spectacular journey to the enchanting town of Ã“bidos and its magical Christmas village!

Our adventure begins with a visit to the Batalha Monastery, a masterpiece of both Portuguese and European architecture. As we explore the monastery, you'll immerse yourself in the rich history that shaped Portugal.

After lunch, our journey continues to the captivating Christmas village nestled in the heart of Ã“bidos. Unleash your inner child in this truly magical place! Ã“bidos boasts a medieval charm that will transport you back in time. Roam the cobbled streets and discover the quaint corners of this village, each whispering tales of old Portugal.

The Christmas village is a wonderland of festive delights, offering something for everyone. From a towering giant wheel to an exhilarating ice-skating rink, and from a magnificent Christmas Tree to a heartwarming nativity scene â€“ the magic of the season comes alive in every corner. This is an opportunity to experience the joy of the holidays in a setting that captures the essence of yuletide cheer.

Join us to make this holiday season one to remember, surrounded by the beauty of architecture, the spirit of history, and the enchantment of Christmas magic!

name: Circus Party
description:
Step right up, party enthusiasts!

Ever thought, "How cool is it to go to an ESN Porto party?" Well, hold onto your party hats because we've just cranked up the coolness to circus-level proportions!

Picture this: clowns with dance moves that put your best friend to shame, being able to buy popcorn and cotton candy in between songs. Welcome to the CIRCUS PARTY - where the only thing wilder than the lion tamer is the dance floor!

The fact that this party is unlike any other, you are already sure, but the most wholesome thing is to come! There will be plenty of fun dynamics and challenges throughout the night. To participate in some of them, we ask you to pay/donate a symbolic amount. In the end, this money will be donated to OperaÃ§Ã£o Nariz Vermelho, an association that provides clown care for kids in hospitals. What's better than to help a good cause while you are having fun? ğŸ¥°

Break out your wildest party attire and let your inner ringmaster or trapeze artist shine. This is not just a party; it's a spectacle, a carnival of culture, and a celebration that'll have you saying, "Why haven't we combined clubbing and circus before?" 

So, grab your friends, your sense of adventure, and let's turn the night into a circus of memories that'll have everyone in the city talking. CIRCUS PARTY - because regular parties are so last season! ğŸªğŸ’ƒğŸ¼

And at the end of the pubcrawl, you'll be thinking, "How cool is it to go to an ESN Porto Pubcrawl?" Well, hold onto your party hats because we've just cranked up the coolness to circus-level proportions at Plano B!

Picture this: clowns with dance moves that put your best friend to shame, being able to buy popcorn and cotton candy in between songs. Welcome to the CIRCUS PARTY - where the only thing wilder than the lion tamer is the dance floor!

The fact that this party is unlike any other, you are already sure, but the most wholesome thing is to come! There will be plenty of fun dynamics and challenges throughout the night. To participate in some of them, we ask you to pay/donate a symbolic amount. In the end, this money will be donated to OperaÃ§Ã£o Nariz Vermelho, an association that provides clown care for kids in hospitals. What's better than to help a good cause while you are having fun? ğŸ¥°

So, grab your friends, your sense of adventure, and let's turn the night into a circus of memories that'll have everyone in the city talking. CIRCUS PARTY - because regular parties are so last season! ğŸªğŸ’ƒ

Only the greatest survive Porto and our unforgettable parties ğŸ’™

Are you ready to say goodbye to Porto in the best way?
Show up to our Pubcrawl & Circus Party and prove it! ğŸ˜‰

So, are you ready to upgrade your erasmus experience and leave your mark on our lovely city through social impact with our elders? If the answer is yes, grab your things and come with us!

name: Careoke Night
description:
Greetings music lovers!

Prepare your vocal cords for an unforgettable night of music, laughter, and a touch of linguistic confusion. We proudly present to you our much-anticipated event: "Careoke Night"! Now, before you start questioning our spelling skills, let us assure you â€“ there's a method to our linguistic madness.

Why "Careoke" you ask? Because it's not just about hitting those high notes; it's about hitting the high notes of compassion. This isn't your ordinary karaoke night; it's a night where every note you sing resonates with care and kindness.

We invite each and every one of you to bring a non-perishable food item â€“ a small gesture that will make a huge difference. Let's turn our passion for karaoke into a harmonious symphony of generosity! All the items will be donated to ADDIM, a non-profit organization that provides assistance to women and children victims of crime and/or discrimination.

Don't miss out on the chance to sing your heart out for a good cause. See you at "Careoke Night" â€“ where every song has a purpose and every voice makes a difference!

Now, the spotlight is on you to immerse yourself in the vibrant and eccentric world of the 80s. Picture yourself surrounded by neon colors, black light, and the infectious beats of 80s music. name: Trip to Coimbra
description:
Hey there, travelers! Are you up to the next trip? ğŸš
Do you love to travel? Do you like partying and studentsâ€™ academic traditions? If so, this trip is going to be all you have been waiting for this semester, and more! âœ¨

If youâ€™ve done your â€œPortugal Starter Packâ€ research, at this point you know that Coimbra is one of the most important cities in Portugal. Coimbra is full of history in every corner and mixes the traditions and its magnificent old architecture with the youngness of being â€œthe city of studentsâ€. ğŸ‘©ğŸ¼â€ğŸ“ ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¼â€ğŸ“

We will start in a place where everybody will feel like a giant: Portugal dos Pequenitos! It is one very picturesque place, as everything is dwarfed in size, in the most famous miniature park in Portugal! Are you ready to discover the world from a different perspective? 

Well, while at the student city, we canâ€™t miss visiting the University of Coimbra - the oldest in Portugal and one of the oldest in Europe - that inspired the costumes of Harry Potter and all the other students in Hogwartsâ€¦I know, a pretty epic scenario!

About PaÃ§o das Escolas, we are talking about UNESCO World Heritage. It was the Royal Square since D. Afonso Henriques Kingdom, first king of Portugal in 1140 (oof thatâ€™s a lot of years ago). The Biblioteca Joanina is located at PaÃ§o das Escolas and it is a Baroque style Library, known as one of the biggest and most original European Baroque libraries! 

Do you want to have an amazing Erasmus experience and absorb as much as possible of our University culture? Check the program below!

name: Trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva
description:
Hey there, adventurers!

If you're looking for a breathtaking and unforgettable outdoor adventure through nature, then a trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is an absolute must!

Located in one of the five UNESCO Global Geoparks in Portugal, in Arouca, Aveiro, PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is a network of walkways that stretches over more than 8 km along the banks of the Paiva river.

As you make your way along the walkways, you'll be treated to stunning views of the river and the surrounding mountains, as well as numerous waterfalls and other natural wonders, where you might have a chance to refresh yourself :)

But PassadiÃ§os do Paiva isn't just about the scenery. Along the way, you'll also encounter a variety of wildlife and flora, including rare and endangered species that are native to the region. So, are you ready to discover the amazing landscapes along the Paiva river?


Check out the program:

8h30 Meeting Point â€“ Trindade (we leave Porto)

11h00 Arrival at PassadiÃ§os do Paiva

11h15 Free time at the beach

12h30 Trekking (beginning) until the middle beach 

13h30 Time for lunch 

15h00 Trekking until the end 

17h00 Free time to chill out in a relaxed garden

18h00 Departure from PassadiÃ§os do Paiva 

20h00 Arrival in Porto 


What: PassadiÃ§os do Paiva (Paiva Walkways)

When:  Sunday, 15th of October, 8h30

Where: Trindade (map here)

Price: 14â‚¬

What to bring: Comfortable clothes and shoes, bathing suit, food for the day, water, your ESNcard and lots of motivation!

What is included:

  • Entrance in PassadiÃ§os do Paiva
  • Transportation from Porto to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva

name: Trip to Sexta-Feira 13 Montalegre
description:
Hello little demons, ğŸ˜ˆ

As this is a spooky month we want to show you a very spooky traditional party, full of superstition and mysticism!

We are talking about â€œNoite das Bruxasâ€ (Witch night) that happens every Friday the 13th in Montalegre. It is based on the myths, tales and legends of the popular culture of the region.
Itâ€™s said that the Witches leave the Misarela Bridge to terrorize the region...

Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to feel the mystic traditions in the streets, the decorations, theatre performances, concerts and the fireworks. This is the time to let go of all of your sinsâ€¦ Or perhaps commit some more.

Usually, it gets a little cold in Montalegreâ€¦ But youâ€™ll get warm with the typical drink â€œQueimadaâ€ which will ward off the evil eye. However, if itâ€™s extremely hot, itâ€™s because of you.
Who knows which spells youâ€™ll be under this nightâ€¦ Join us to find out!

name: Fado & Tapas Night
description:
Hello Portugal fans!

Have you been in the city for a few days already and want to finally absorb even more of Portugalâ€™s culture? Donâ€™t worry, we've got you covered! Get on board and experience one of the most typical Portuguese nights ever: Fado & Tapas Night. ğŸ¶

Here you will have the opportunity to not only listen to the heart moving art of Fado, but also to taste some delicious Tapas, such as Bifanas, Moelas, RojÃµes, Caldo Verde (soup), different types of cheeses and Vinho do Porto (Port Wine) obviously! Other drinks are also included such as water, juices and other wines (white and red). And if you're vegetarian, you can still participate in this event as we have prepared an equally delicious menu for you, that includes Vegetable Quiche, Ratatouille and others. ğŸ˜‹ 

Are you ready to join us and learn some of our Portuguese culture?

Join us on the 3rd of October and start crossing items from your Porto bucket list! âœ”ï¸

description:

(passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your ESNcard. 


ğŸš¨ Warning: This trip includes a total of 8km trekking (4km to Drave + 4km back) and it is considered to be of moderate difficulty.

Itâ€™s time to hit the road to Draveâ€¦ but what is Drave?!

If you donâ€™t know, thereâ€™s nothing to be ashamed of! Many good old Portuguese fellows are also not fully familiar with it but weâ€™re here to enlighten you!

This hidden gem is located in the Arouca Geopark and it is an old abandoned village in the middle of mountains and maintained by scouts, composed of schist houses, which are typical villages all throughout Portugal! If the breathtaking views donâ€™t already impress you, these houses will rock!

But if you think this national treasure was easily reached you couldnâ€™t be more wrongâ€¦ thereâ€™s a reason why it is called a hidden gem and it is because itâ€™s not connected to highways (the fact that you canâ€™t drive to Draveâ€¦) and it takes a 4km trekking from the nearest village to get there!

Good thing isâ€¦ our path will be filled with waterfalls, natural pools, where you will be able to swim and rest for a while.

If youâ€™re up to a challenge and an outside-of-the-box pick to impress your instagram followersâ€¦ this one's for you!

Hereâ€™s the timeframe for this trip:

8h30: Meeting Point @Trindade

10h30: Arrival to Regoufe

10h30-10h30: Arrival to Drave

12h30: Free-time

16h00: Trekking back to Regoufe

18h00: Arrival to Regoufe

20h00: Arrival to Porto @Trindade

What: Trip to Drave

When: Saturday, September 30th, 8h30

Where: Trindade Station (map here)

Price: 20â‚¬

What is included: Bus trip to the village and back to Porto

What to bring: Your ESNcard, food for lunch, sunscreen, caps/hats, swimsuit, towel, sunglasses, hiking shoes and enough water to fill the Nile

Are you a travel and history lover?

So donâ€™t waste the opportunity to meet the city where Portugal was born! Get your backpack ready and come with us for an adventure in the city of GuimarÃ£es.

It used to be our countryâ€™s capital and, despite losing this title, brims with history and is a next step on your journey to discover Portuguese culture. Prepare yourself for a day surrounded by remarkable landmarks spread both across the city and the nature, while you visit both the castle (Castelo de GuimarÃ£es) and the Palace (PaÃ§o dos Duques), finished off by the sheer beauty of a view on Serra da Penha peak.

It is a historical center classified as a part of World Heritage by UNESCO since 2001 and we promise that it will be a birthplace of many amazing memories for you and your new international friendships.

Seems like it will be a remarkable day in your lifeâ€¦ Are you ready to make history?

We will give you the possibility to visit one of the most beautiful natural wonders of Portugal! Letâ€™s go to a magical place with breathtaking views, diversified flora and fauna, natural wonders and other amazing things... Join us in our trip to Peniche and Berlengas!!

The Berlengas archipelago is a group of small islands, situated 10 to 15 kilometers from Peniche, and is considered a World Biosphere Reserve since 2011 by UNESCO, while Peniche is considered Portugalâ€™s surf capital and itâ€™s famous for its marvelous beaches and surfing spots.

Be ready to enjoy the secret wonders of the islands - unique landscapes and hidden caves -, a fantastic view of the Atlantic Ocean from Cabo Carvoeiro, beautiful NazarÃ© where the biggest wave in the world was recorded or just take a swim in beautiful clear water!

Aveiro is Portugueseâ€™s Venice and on this amazing trip you will be able to enjoy the beautiful views and discover the city on board of traditional boats called â€œMoliceirosâ€, â›µ taking you for stunning trips on the canal running through the town. All the enchanting buildings of the art nouveau style will catch your eye and invite you to stop and wander inside for a peek at Aveiroâ€™s history.

In this romantic city thereâ€™s also a traditional sweet called â€œOvos-Molesâ€ and on this trip you will be able to not just eat them but to actually learn how to make them! â€œOvos-Molesâ€ are made from egg yolks and sugar, they have shapes of clams, barrels, fish and they are delicious! ğŸ¤¤

And to finish, we will end this awesome trip at a fishermanâ€™s village called â€œCosta Nova'' known for its beautiful striped houses. You will wander watching such beautiful houses that will make you want to take tons of pictures. ğŸ“· 

Last, but not least, youâ€™ll have some time to enjoy the beach in Costa Nova! â›±ï¸

So, are you ready to experience Portugueseâ€™s Venice with us?

Berlengas is an archipelago situated 10 to 15 km from Peniche that has been considered a World Biosphere Reserve since 2011 by UNESCO. Meanwhile, Peniche is Portugal surf capital and is recognized worldwide for its stunning beaches and, of course, surfing spots.

Prepare yourself to discover the hidden gems of the archipelago, such as is unique landscapes and concealed caves, witness the breathtaking view of the Atlantic Ocean from Cabo Carvoeiro, visit the beautiful town of NazarÃ©, which recorded the biggest waves in the world, or just simply take a refreshing swim in its crystal-clear waters!

description:
Dear liver,

ESN Porto presents the last pubcrawl of the semester, celebrating the vibrant city of Porto! We would never let you go home without this! Join us for this unforgettable night of revelry one last time because without you, Porto just won't be the same.

And how will it work? We will all gather in front of Museu da Fotografia (map here) at 20h30 sharp. We always start with our favorite game: Sangria Line!

Pleaseee, don't be late (or you'll miss the beginning of the games!)

You will be divided into teams and then you will have a map telling you where the pubs are. (The map is usually an ESNerâ€¦) Along with the pubs, your team will get a special list of CHALLENGES to accomplish during all the event! Can you live up to the challenge? 

Don't miss out on this incredible experience that embraces adventure, camaraderie, and the unique charm of Porto. Your presence is what makes this event truly special. Secure your spot and join the festivities because without you, the spirit of Porto will be incomplete.

In 1963, the ArrÃ¡bida Bridge was the largest concrete arch in the world. And since 2016, the arch became the only one in Europe that is open to visitors. ESN Porto is offering you a unique opportunity to have access to a building that has been closed to the public for 53 years. Come with us and enjoy this adventure!

name: [FULL] Trip to Drave
description:
ğŸš¨ Warning: This trip includes a total of 8km trekking (4km to Drave + 4km back) and it is considered to be of moderate difficulty.


tâ€™s time to hit the road to Draveâ€¦ but what is Drave?!

If you donâ€™t know, thereâ€™s nothing to be ashamed of! Many good old Portuguese fellows are also not fully familiar with it but weâ€™re here to enlighten you!

This hidden gem is located in the Arouca Geopark and it is an old abandoned village composed of schist houses (not to be confused with ğŸ’©) which are typical villages all throughout Portugal! If the breathtaking views donâ€™t already impress you these houses will rock!

But if you think this national treasure was easily reached you couldnâ€™t be more wrongâ€¦ thereâ€™s a reason why it is called a hidden gem and it is because itâ€™s not connected to highways (the fact that you canâ€™t drive to draveâ€¦) and it takes a 4km trekking from the nearest village to get there!

Good thing isâ€¦ our path will be filled with waterfalls, natural pools and a killing energy sponsored by your ESNers and fellow Erasmus!

If youâ€™re up to a challenge and an outside-of-the-box pick to impress your instagram followersâ€¦ this one's for you! 


Hereâ€™s the timeframe for this trip:

8h: Meeting Point @Trindade

8h30: Departure

10h30: Arrival to Regoufe

10h30-13h30: Arrival to Drave

13h30: Free-time

16h30: Trekking back to Regoufe

19h30: Arrival to Regoufe

21h30: Arrival to Porto @Trindade

description:
Hey, amazing ones!

Hope you are already feeling the vibes of a summerish Porto but, before the beach and waves period occupies your entire schedule, we invite  you to come with us to promote Mobility to young local students from a remote area near Porto. 

As one of our causes is Inclusivity For All, we feel the need to share the opportunities of the Erasmus+ Program to young people with less contact with this information. Would you help us impact the local community?

From us you can expect a car ride,  lunch and lots of fun. Still in doubt?

name: [FULL] Cultural Saturday @Serralves
description:
Hello, soon-to-be cultural experts!

Let's have fun and explore Serralves, an 18-hectare park well known for its biodiversity and its varied environments (lakes, ponds, forests, gardens, â€¦). Beyond its natural beauty, Serralves is home to lots of art, be it in the museum or spread out throughout the park, such as a huge shovel stuck on the ground at one of the entrances.

Fortunately, youâ€™ll get to visit all of the important bits in a guided tour. The tour will show you the museum with its multiple exhibitions, from traditional to more abstract ones. Some current exhibitions that you may see include art by Carla Filipe, Manoel de Oliveira, Rui Chafes and maybe even a smidge of MirÃ³. Walk through the Treetop, a wooden path built around the trees that lets you see the park from a new perspective (try not to look down if you get queasy with heights!), and, obviously, the park is proper.

What are you waiting to join us and show us your artistic and abstract side?

name: [FULL] Trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva
description:
Hey, adventurers!

If you are looking for a breathtaking and unforgettable outdoor adventure, then a trip to PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is an absolute must!

Located in one of the five UNESCO Global Geoparks in Portugal, in Arouca, Aveiro, PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is a network of walkways that stretches over more than 8 km along the banks of the Paiva river. As you make your way along the walkways, you will be treated to stunning views of the river and the surrounding mountains, as well as numerous waterfalls and other natural wonders, where you will have a chance to refresh yourself!

But PassadiÃ§os do Paiva is not just about the scenery... Along the way, you will also encounter a variety of wildlife and flora, including rare and endangered species that are native to the region! So, are you ready to discover the amazing landscapes along the Paiva river?

You must be really confused at this point, "Doesnâ€™t ESN know how to spell?", but there is a reason behind the title of the event. We only ask a little favor of you guys. If you can, bring some school supplies to support Panela100Tampa, a non-profit organization that fights for basic human rights and seeks to combat social exclusion by empowering families, children and young people and that just furnished the construction of a school in a village in Guinea-Bissau.

name: [CANCELLED] Trip to Sintra
description:
Dear travel buddy,

We know that you've already had the opportunity to visit some of the most beautiful cities in Portugal, so what we've prepared for you this time is a trip to a village that is as beautiful as it is charming - SINTRA.

With a name that means moon, the village of Sintra is a magical place where the mountains abound in mysteries and legends, ending imposingly over the ocean. As the saying goes, we will be in the place â€œWhere the land ends and the sea begins.â€ 

As it is a versatile destination, on this trip you will have the opportunity to visit a palace that seems to be taken from a princess movie, lose yourself in the beauty of the most enchanting and mysterious gardens, lose your breath with some of the most beautiful views in Portugal, set foot on the westernmost point of Continental Europe and, last but not least, have an adventure in our beloved capital.

The advice we can give you is to prepare yourself to live in a real-life fairy tale and to prepare your jaw to be amazed more often than usual, as this trip includes a visit to one of the seven wonders of Portugal (PalÃ¡cio da Pena), to a property classified as world heritage by UNESCO (Quinta da Regaleira), while you will have also one of the best moments of your exchange, accompanied by out best friends and your favorite ESNers. :)

name: [CANCELLED] Trip to Sintra [UP Discount]
description:
Dear travel buddy,

We know that you've already had the opportunity to visit some of the most beautiful cities in Portugal, so what we've prepared for you this time is a trip to a village that is as beautiful as it is charming - SINTRA.  

With a name that means moon, the village of Sintra is a magical place where the mountains abound in mysteries and legends, ending imposingly over the ocean. As the saying goes, we will be in the place â€œWhere the land ends and the sea begins.â€ 

As it is a versatile destination, on this trip you will have the opportunity to visit a palace that seems to be taken from a princess movie, lose yourself in the beauty of the most enchanting and mysterious gardens, lose your breath with some of the most beautiful views in Portugal, set foot on the westernmost point of Continental Europe and, last but not least, have an adventure in our beloved capital.

The advice we can give you is to prepare yourself to live in a real-life fairy tale and to prepare your jaw to be amazed more often than usual, as this trip includes a visit to one of the seven wonders of Portugal (PalÃ¡cio da Pena), to a property classified as world heritage by UNESCO (Quinta da Regaleira), while you will have also one of the best moments of your exchange, accompanied by out best friends and your favorite ESNers. :)

You don't want to miss this opportunity, so make sure you secure your spot!

name: [FULL] Trip to Coimbra
description:
Hey there, travelers! Are you up to the next trip? 

Do you love to travel? Do you like partying and studentsâ€™ academic traditions? If so, this trip is going to be all you have been waiting for this semester, and more!

If youâ€™ve done your â€œPortugal Starter Packâ€ research, at this point you know that Coimbra is one of the most important cities in Portugal. Coimbra is full of history in every corner and mixes the traditions and its magnificent old architecture with the youngness of being â€œthe city of studentsâ€.

We will start from the very beginning: when Coimbra was a roman city! We will start with RuÃ­nas de Conimbriga, one of the oldest, biggest and most important archeology traces in Portugal. It used to be a city during the Roman Empire. Letâ€™s dig into some ruins and resurrect B.C. memories.

Well, weâ€™re still gonna visit a library and the University of Coimbra - the oldest in Portugal and one of the oldest in Europe - that inspired the costumes of Harry Potter and all the other students in Hogwartsâ€¦I know, a pretty epic scenario! 


About PaÃ§o das Escolas, we are talking about UNESCO World Heritage. It was the Royal Square since D. Afonso Henriques Kingdom, first king of Portugal in 1140 (oof thatâ€™s a lot of years ago). The Biblioteca Joanina is located at PaÃ§o das Escolas and it is a Baroque style Library, known as one of the biggest and most original European Baroque libraries!

Do you want to have an amazing Erasmus experience and absorb as much as possible of our University culture? Check the program below!

This time we bring you a proposal for a trip back in time: we are going to the oldest Portuguese city!

Also known as the Rome of Portugal, you will have the opportunity to visit the city that abounds in flower gardens and churches, in addition to being recognized for its typical pastries - we are talking about Frigideiras, TÃ­bias and, also, Pudim Abade de Priscos.

In 2012 it was elected the European Youth Capital and this city is the reason why the days of the week in Portuguese are counted differently from Spanish or English.

During this trip, you will see the beautiful Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte. It is located on the top of a mountain with an incredible view of the city. Make sure you bring comfortable sneakers because youâ€™ll have 581 steps to climb. No joke. But trust us, itâ€™s worth it!

Hello dear culture and food seekers,

Welcome to the event where Portuguese music joins traditional food in a culturally dynamic night! Want to join the best of both worlds while meeting new friends? This is the perfect moment to sit around the table having a talk and a tapa in the best mood!

Discover more about this country by listening to Fado part of UNESCO's Cultural Heritage. The Fado's group formed by ISEP faculty students will be the soundtrack of this nostalgic, moving and memorable night. Learn Portuguese by beautiful lyrics, rhythm and melody!

About the food and goodies, that is secured by the richness of Tapas. They come from Bifanas, RojÃµes, Alheiras (meat), and Caldo Verde (soup). Don't worry, vegetarian alternatives are available. Also, drinks such as Vinho do Porto (Port Wine), water, juice, and wines are included.

First of all, welcome to Port(o)gal!

New in town? Don't know many people yet? Not sure where to start? ESN Porto can help you out. 

Picture yourself with 46 other Erasmus students, games and parties with nature all around youâ€¦ Starting to sound good, right?  So, we present to you: The Erasmus Camp!

This weekend will be all about getting to know your fellow Erasmus colleagues and your favorite ESNers! We will have lots of games, activities and time to chill for everyone to get to know each other.

But first, where is this all going to happen?! Our weekend will be spent in Ponte de Lima, the oldest village in Portugal. The perfect place for our weekend: surrounded by nature but also with a bunch of places to have fun.

During these 2 days we are going to have a lot of activities, games and a chill time for everyone to get to know each other! We are talking about:

  • Ice breaking games 
  • Cool activities and contests (Disney games vibesğŸ‘€)
  • A whole new family (literally)
  • (Un)forgettable warm up and party
  • Some contact with Mother Nature doing trekking

Saturday,  18th of february 

8:30 - Meeting Point Metro da Trindade 

10:30 - Visit to Santa Luzia viewpoint @Viana do Castelo

11:45 -  Check-in @ Pousada da Juventude

12:30 -  Free time for lunch 

14:00 - Bonding time

18:00 - Free Time 

20:00 - Dinner time @Gaio Restaurant 

23:30 - Party time @FAMA club

8:30 - Rise and Shine

10:30 - Wake-up Trekking

12:30 - Free Time for lunch 

14:00 - Adventure activities time (Canoeing, Archery, Slide, Rappelling)

18:00 - Family trip back to Puorto <3

Erasmus students studying at the University of Porto will get a 20â‚¬ discount. Discounts are limited to the first 15 people buying. description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 20â‚¬, with our Welcome Kit included (T-shirt, totebag, cup and cup holder ribbon, survival kit, SIMcard) it is valid for one year. You must bring a photo of yourself (passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your ESNcard.


Hello travel lovers!

Do you want to visit a city full of traditional boats, enchanting and colorful buildings and eat traditional sweets? Then you are in for a treat!

Aveiro is Portugueseâ€™s Venice and on this amazing trip you will be able to enjoy the beautiful views and discover the city on board of traditional boats called â€œMoliceirosâ€, taking you for stunning trips on the canal running through the town.  All the enchanting buildings of the art nouveau style will catch your eye and invite you to stop and wander inside for a peek at Aveiroâ€™s history.

In this romantic city thereâ€™s also a traditional sweet called â€œOvos-Molesâ€ and on this trip you will be able to not just eat them but to actually learn how to make them! This local delicacy translates literally to â€œsoft eggs from Aveiroâ€ and itâ€™s made from egg yolks and sugar. The filling is soft due to the freshness of the ingredients. Surrounding it is a pastry made from wheat flour, which will give the sweets the typical shapes of clams, barrels, fish, and more.

And to finish, we will end this awesome trip at a fishermanâ€™s village called â€œCosta Nova'' known for its beautiful striped houses and spend some time beside the beach side.

So, are you ready to experience Portugueseâ€™s Venice with us?


This is our program:

8:30h: Meeting point (Trindade)

10:00h: Arrival to Aveiro

10:30h-13:30h: Boat trip and Ovos-Moles Workshop

13:30h: Free time for lunch

15h: City Tour

16:30h: Visit to Costa Nova Village and beach

18h: Departure to Porto

If you are not a student from UP, your place will not be secured and you need to buy from the main event page.


Beloved students! Unfortunately, we bring you the last event of the semester, and we could only finish it in style, with one more trip to remember. It is time to celebrate the great times we had together and have one last unforgettable trip. We want to make it big this time, so we are going a bit further with our trips and going abroad to the World Heritage city of Salamanca in Spain. Known for its beautiful architecture, Salamanca is also a big academic city.

You will have the opportunity to explore the marvelous cobbled streets during the day, and at night we are going to party in the famous Nochevieja!

So what is Nochevieja? Nochevieja was born spontaneously in 1999 when a group of university students decided to gather in Salamanca's Plaza Mayor to celebrate a kind of New Year's Eve before everyone from their group went home! That turned out in a tradition that grew bigger every year, and nowadays the last Nochevieja edition has joined 35000 people. Students gather in Plaza Mayor and eat 12 gums after the bells signal midnight, and then proceed to go out to party all night.


Here is the program:

09:30 - Departure from Porto
15:15 - (Spanish time) Arrival to Salamanca
16:00 - City Tour

21:30 - Entrance for Nochevieja
00:01 - Party all night!!!

10:00 - (Portuguese time) Arrival to Porto*

name: [FULL] Cultural Sunday + Picnic @Serralves
description:
Hello everyone! Ready for a Sunday full of culture?

Let's have fun and explore Serralves, an 18 hectare park well known for its biodiversity and its varied environments (lakes, ponds, forests, gardens, â€¦). Beyond its natural beauty, Serralves is home to lots of art, be it in the museum or spread out throughout the park, such as a huge shovel stuck on the ground on one of the entrances.

Fortunately, youâ€™ll get to visit all of the important bits in a guided tour. The tour will show you the museum with its multiple exhibitions, from traditional to more abstract ones. For example, some main highlights like Paula Rego, Augustina Bessa-LuÃ­s and Cindy Sherman. Walk through the Treetop, a wooden path built around the trees that lets you see the park from a new perspective (try not to look down if you get queasy with heights!), and, obviously, the park proper.

In the end a Picnic is awaiting in the immense garden, where you can calmly take in the sights with us and your friends! Feel free to bring some additional snacks if you want to!

To start the journey, you will also have the opportunity to visit a historic medieval village, where one of the greatest national battles of independence took place. As a result of the victory, the king, in recognition, ordered the construction of the Aljubarrota Monestry. This monument is known for its beautiful Portuguese Gothic architecture, and it took more than two centuries to be completed!

After that, we will take you to the Christmas village, which is held in the medieval city of Ã“bidos, making this experience magical on a completely different level! You will explore Portugal's ancient architecture, such as the castle, as well as, check out all the decorations and celebrate the Christmas spirit! âœ¨ 

Once inside this magical place, you will automatically let your inner child loose, and experience all that the village has to offer, from a giant wheel, an ice-skating rink to a big Christmas Tree ğŸ„, a Santa Claus' House ğŸ…, and a nativity scene.

name: Fado & Tapas Night II
description:
Hello Portugal Culture lovers,

Here comes another incredible cultural event for you, this time is all about music and some food! We present to you a good opportunity to learn more about our Portuguese culture and at the same time have fun, eat great food and meet new people. 

You will get a chance to listen to a part of UNESCO's Cultural Heritage: Fado, performed by the Grupo de Fado do ISEP, formed by local students. This typical Portuguese music genre is characterized by mournful and melancholic tunes and lyrics, and will truly move you no matter what language you speak. 

Worry not, during the performance, traditional Portuguese food will be served - we are talking about Bifanas, RojÃµes, Alheiras (meat), and Caldo Verde (soup). Also, drinks such as Vinho do Porto (Port Wine), water, juice, and wines will be served.
So, are you ready to experience another evening that only Porto can offer?

name: [FULL] Trip to S. Martinho Penafiel
description:
Hello brave travelers!

Itâ€™s Autumn time and that means it's time for Magusto! Every year, this time of the year, Portuguese people come together to eat castanhas assadas (roasted chestnuts) ğŸŒ° and drink the new wine of this yearâ€™s harvest ğŸ·. 

And this is what this trip is all about! Letâ€™s celebrate this time of the year, traveling to one of the most famous Magusto in Portugal, the celebration of S. Martinho, in Penafiel.

S. Martinho is a celebration in honor of the Saint Martin that became a Saint for a notable act, when he had cut his cloak in half to share with a beggar during a snowstorm, to save him from the cold. The legend said that the snowstorm stopped and the sun rose. Thatâ€™s why in November, when itâ€™s sunny, we call it VerÃ£o de S. Martinho (Saint Martin summer).

Join us in one of the most famous Portuguese traditional holidays and discover good food, wine and also have fun with the people, music and carnival rides! ğŸ·ğŸŒ°ğŸ¡

name: [FULL] Adapted Sports with FC Porto
description:
Are you a sports fan? Well, for this activity you donâ€™t need to be one.

In fact, as ESN is celebrating the Social Impact Days (SID), we are looking forward to giving you experiences that can make you reflect on the community we live in and how to change each otherâ€™s lives little by little, as one.

The SID are meant to raise social awareness and every ESN section from all over the world is doing special activities and events at the same time!

During this activity we planned to play Goalball which is a collective sport meant for people who are visually impaired. The objective of the game is to put the ball on the adversaryâ€™s goal by using your hand. For this you will need to use a blindfold so you can play according to the rules. 

You will be able to spot the ball by the sound of the bells inside of it so, during this game, you will need to concentrate and use the sense of touch and hearing.

We would like to have you with us this evening to try a different sport while having tons of fun and never forgetting the important message behind it: it is crucial to fight for inclusion for all in sports and life!

So sign in and join us, with you around is always funnier. ğŸ˜Š


What: Adapted Sports: Goalball

Where: FADEUP (map here)

When: 18th of November, 18h15

Price: Free!

What to bring: Comfortable clothes and your ESNcard

name: Office After Hours: Social Impact Days
description:

After the working hours, our Office becomes lonely and darkâ€¦just kidding! This is when the fun starts! Would you dare to join us Office After Hours - Social Impact days?

ESN is celebrating the Social Impact Days all over the world between the 7th and 20th of November, which means we want to get closer to our community, to give you a floor to share your thoughts and closely impact each otherâ€™s lives. ESN believes the whole society can have benefits from mobility programs. In this sense, the â€œSocial Impact Days'' is a project related to ESNâ€™s mission: the enrichment of society through international students.

During this activity we aim to debate some topics related to mobility and how to keep our own balance during this life changing experience. When we find ourselves in a new city, who can help us during the tough times? Is it possible to build a family during mobility? How can I improve other peopleâ€™s lives?

Do you want to make a difference and know how to make a positive Social Impact? Come and join us during a cosy and chill afternoon.

Sintra is a charming town near Lisbon where the stunning nature and the beautiful historical building and monuments mix, creating one of the destinations in Portugal that you can't miss.

In this trip, you will have the opportunity to spend some time in a
palace like the ones you only see in movies, PalÃ¡cio da Pena, fall in love with the most romantic gardens youâ€™ll ever see and run out of breath with the natural landscape in Quinta da Regaleira, classified as world heritage by UNESCO. Don't forget about Cabo da Roca, the place "where the land ends and the sea begins", as it is the farthest point to west in Europe.

You will also have time to explore a little bit of Lisbon during the trip!ğŸ˜

Hello explorer friend,

Hey travelers! Ready to go on an adventure?

We will give you the possibility to visit one of the most beautiful natural wonders of Portugal! Letâ€™s go to a magical place with breathtaking views, diversified flora and fauna, natural wonders and other amazing things... Join us in our trip to Peniche and Berlengas!!  

The Berlengas archipelago is a group of small islands, situated 10 to 15 kilometers from Peniche, and is considered a World Biosphere Reserve since 2011 by UNESCO, while Peniche is considered Portugalâ€™s surf capital and itâ€™s famous for its marvelous beaches and surfing spots.

Be ready to enjoy the secret wonders of the islands - unique landscapes and hidden caves -, a fantastic view of the Atlantic Ocean from Cabo Carvoeiro, beautiful NazarÃ© where the biggest wave in the world was recorded or just take a swim in beautiful clear water!

description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. Hello there people!

 

Are you ready for an amazing trip to one of the most beautiful cities of Portugal? Well, this time we are going to take you to the Portuguese Venice and one of the most romantic Portuguese cities! 

Surrounded by salt-flats, beaches, lagoons and incredible colourful little houses, here you will be able to enjoy the view next to the watercourse and discover the city on board of a typical boat called â€œMoliceiroâ€.

Then you will have the opportunity to learn how to make a traditional sweet from Portugal called Ovos-Moles, made with egg yolks and sugar, and the best part is: you can taste them afterwards!

To finish things off, we will take you around the cityâ€™s best spots and end the trip at a fishermanâ€™s village called â€œCosta Novaâ€ known for itâ€™s beautiful striped houses. If you are brave enough, you will be able to soak your feet in the ocean at the beach.

 

This is our program:

08h30: Meeting point at Trindade Station (map here) 

10h00: Arrival to Aveiro

10h30-12h00 - Boat trip/City Tour

12h00: Free time for lunch and visit Aveiro

14h00-16h00: Ovos Moles Workshop

16h00: Visit to Costa Nova Village and beach

18h00: Departure to Porto

name: Trip to Peniche & Berlengas
description:
Hey travellers! Ready to go on an adventure?


We will give you the possibility to visit one of the most beautiful natural wonders of Portugal! Letâ€™s go to a magical place with breathtaking views, diversified flora and fauna, natural wonders and other amazing things... Join us in our trip to Peniche and Berlengas!!

The Berlengas archipelago is a group of small islands, situated 10 to 15 kilometers from Peniche, and is considered a World Biosphere Reserve since 2011 by UNESCO, while Peniche is considered Portugalâ€™s surf capital and itâ€™s famous for its marvellous beaches and surfing spots.

Be ready to enjoy the secret wonders of the islands - unique landscapes and hidden caves -, a fantastic view of the Atlantic Ocean from Cabo Carvoeiro, beautiful NazarÃ© where the biggest wave in the world was recorded or just take a swim in beautiful clear water!

name: Erasmus in Schools @Escola SecundÃ¡ria do CastÃªlo da Maia
description:
Hey there lovely erasmus,

Have you ever thought about sharing with our younger generation your Erasmus experience and what made you take this step? Come with us and letâ€™s motivate young portuguese students to have this great experience in a couple years :) You can even educate them a little bit about your own country! Open your homeland to them! You can teach them some Turkish or German, or simply let the kids have a taste of your culture.

And how would you like to see first hand the interior of a Portuguese school? Then this event is definitely for you!

Erasmus in Schools is a nationwide project aimed for all Erasmus students interested in visiting local/nearby schools during their stay in Portugal.

Enjoy the opportunity to visit a Portuguese High School where youâ€™ll get the chance to teach and tell Portuguese children about their home country and answer their questions.

How can you do this?

- by showing pictures, objects and whatever you want from back home.

- be creative! The idea is for the kids to learn about your origins and experience :)

Most kids at that age already speak pretty good English here in Portugal, but just in case there will always be ESNers helping you out and translating everything.

What: Erasmus in Schools

name: Erasmus in Schools @Escola SecundÃ¡ria Almeida Garrett
description:
Hey there lovely erasmus,

Have you ever thought about sharing with our younger generation your Erasmus experience and what made you take this step? Come with us and letâ€™s motivate young portuguese students to have this great experience in a couple years :) You can even educate them a little bit about your own country! Open your homeland to them! You can teach them some Turkish or German, or simply let the kids have a taste of your culture.

And how would you like to see first hand the interior of a Portuguese school? Then this event is definitely for you!

Erasmus in Schools is a nationwide project aimed for all Erasmus students interested in visiting local/nearby schools during their stay in Portugal.

Enjoy the opportunity to visit a Portuguese High School where youâ€™ll get the chance to teach and tell Portuguese children about their home country and answer their questions.

How can you do this?

- by showing pictures, objects and whatever you want from back home.

- be creative! The idea is for the kids to learn about your origins and experience :)

Most kids at that age already speak pretty good English here in Portugal, but just in case there will always be ESNers helping you out and translating everything.

name: Fado & Tapas Night II
description:
Hello lovers of Portuguese culture!

We present to you the second edition of Fado & Tapas Night! If you missed the first edition in March, don't feel bad, we have more fado, more wine and more traditional Portuguese tapas, to quench your thirst for Portuguese culture!

You will have the chance to listen to a part of UNESCOâ€™s Cultural Heritage: Fado, in the form of songs sung by the Grupo de Fados do ISEP. You will also have the opportunity to meet the students who will perform Fado for us. They will grace you with interesting facts and history about this kind of music!

During their performance you will be served traditional portuguese foods such as bifanas, rojÃµes, cheese, alheira, caldo verde and drink some vinho do Porto (port wine). Our menu also includes: water, juice, and wines (white and red). Ready for one of the most Portuguese evenings of your life?

name: The Extraordinary Erasmus Eurovision Party
description:
The Extraordinary Erasmus Eurovision Party

14th of May 2022

Hi there, diversity lovers!

It's that time of the year again: the largest music event celebrating diversity and uniting countries is back. Yes, the Eurovision Song Contest is taking place soon, ESN  is bringing directly from Turin to Porto and it is going to be... Extraordinary! *throws confetti in the air*

Join us for an evening of fun, singing, dancing, drinking, games, making fun of outrageous contestants, and having a laugh at our cultures and countries  - because that's what Eurovision is all about! Oh, and, of course, there will be a projection to watch the grand finale of Europe's beloved crazy song contest and root for our favorite singers!

To get in the Euro-vibe, we invite you to bring any snacks/drinks from your country or others you might want to share, and bring flags to cheer for your country. If you can't, just bring a good mood and your ESN green cup (or any other reusable cup). Your favorite ESNers will take care of everything else!

description:
Hello hiking people,

Are you an adventurer? Do you enjoy being surrounded by nature, swimming in beautiful rivers and sharing all of this with likeminded people? We offer the perfect occasion for you to experience this: Paiva Walkways!

PassadiÃ§os do Paiva (Paiva Walkways) is located in Arouca municipality, Aveiro, Portugal. The walkways have a course of 8,7km, surrounded by unique beautiful landscapes, along brave water downhills. The route begins at the bathing area of Areinho and extends until Espiunca. 

During the walk, you will encounter rivers and beaches where we will stop, and you can refresh yourself :)

So, are you ready to discover the amazing landscapes along the Paiva river?

name: Tascas Route
description:
Hello foodies,

By now we bet that you have already heard about our famous â€œTascasâ€ and if you havenâ€™t, then get ready to uncover one of the best secrets Portugal has to offer! What are the â€œTascasâ€? You may askâ€¦

Basically, they are very traditional and familiar restaurants around the city that serve cheap, tasty and typical food and drinks. They are those little places around you that probably you didn't even notice! And since you probably never actually got to try them out, we want to give you the best Tascas experience!

They are where the best and most typical food can be tasted and where you can find any typical Portuguese eating a delicious cachorrinho or enjoying a glass of wine with a codfish cake we call bolinho de bacalhau.

If you think you were born too late to explore the world and too early to explore the universe, come join us in this Tascas Route because we assure you, you were born in the right time to explore our delicious typical food!
