name: Portuguese Medieval Trip
description:
Hello everyone,

Do you like chocolate? Do you love history?  We know it sounds a strange duo, but this trip is for everyone who has a passion for both!

We'll start the day by visiting Aljubarrota and it's surroundings, the place where one of the most famous and iconic battles in Portuguese history took place. Have you ever heard about Aljubarrota's famous breadmaker? Well by the end of this visit you will know who she was for sure!

Ever wanted to spice up your morning coffee or your warm-ups for your nights? If you ever felt that you needed a mug with breasts or a dick shaped shot glass, during your lunch break you'll be able to visit the ceramics shops in Caldas da Rainha where all your needs can be fulfilled!

Still surrounded by its walls, Ã“bidos beautiful medieval village is where we're going next! Famous for it's Licor de Ginja and chocolate, Ã“bidos will for sure leave a sweet taste in your mouth as we finish this trip in the sweetest way possible, a chocolate festival!!

What are you waiting to join us on this amazing trip? Check the program below!

08h00:Meeting point at Trindade

10h30 - 11h30: Visit to Aljubarrota

11h45 - 12h45: Visit to Mosteiro da Batalha

15h30 - 19h00: Visit to Ã“bidos International Chocolate Festival

21h30:Arrival to Porto

  • Your ESNcard

  • Some money, in case you plan on having lunch in a nearby restaurant, otherwise bring your own lunch

name: Trip to Lisbon
description:
Hello travelers,

Are you brave enough to conquer the capital of Portugal?

In this 3 day adventure youâ€™ll see Lisbonâ€™s amazing sights, monuments and original street art. You can get ready for delicious food and have fun all day (and all night).

Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to visit some of the most iconic monuments and get lost in the cityâ€™s picturesque narrow streets during the day! After thatâ€¦ PARTY ALL NIGHT LONG!!! During these days we are going to visit some places that will take your breath away. We are going to teach you by day and to destroy all of your brain cells by night!!

For example, Terreiro do PaÃ§o, which is one of the most majestic squares in Lisbon. It was once a palace, but got almost completely destroyed after the 1755 earthquake. Castelo de SÃ£o Jorge is an emblematic landmark where you will have an amazing view of the city.

We couldnâ€™t leave without passing by BelÃ©m Tower, a World Heritage site, and probably the most important monument in Lisbon. Itâ€™s a 16th century fortress where you can climb the spiral staircase up to the terrace, where youâ€™ll find a breathtaking panorama of the river. And of course, you couldnâ€™t go home without trying the traditional PASTEL DE BELÃ‰M!

We know you love Porto, but you donâ€™t want to miss the opportunity of spending 3 days with your favorite people showing what real party animals look like.

Lisbon is known as the city of the Seven Hills, but, for you, itâ€™ll be the city of the Seven Deadly Sins. And trust us, what happens in Lisbon, stays in Lisbon.

name: Fado & Tapas Night I
description:
Hello my dears,

Allow us to be your guides through Portuguese culture for one night?

Come with us on this incredible night, where you will have the opportunity to see a performance of a traditional Portuguese musical genre, considered Intangible Heritage of Humanity by Unesco since 2011, Fado.

In addition, during the performance of ISEP's Fado Group, we will serve food (starter dish, called Tapas), such as garlic toast, chickpea salad, caldo verde, etc. Our menu also includes: water, juice, and wines (white and red).

Don't miss this moment with food and music from an amazing country like Portugal.

What: Fado & Tapas Night I

When: Tuesday, 15th of March, 20h

name: Cultural Saturday @Tramcar Museum
description:
Hello everyone!

Porto is a very cultural city and we are here to make sure you get to know some of its most important patrimony. Are you ready get to know it?

On this Cultural Day we will introduce you to the unique Tramcar Museum and take you for a ride on an historical Tram! ğŸ˜


The Tramcar Museum is a museum of the Sociedade de Transportes Colectivos do Porto, holding a collection of electric cars, trailers and vehicles. It was inaugurated in May 1992 and is housed in the former thermoelectric power plant of Massarelos.

After the visit and ride, we invite you to walk with us to Jardins do PalÃ¡cio de Cristal to explore the gardens and watch the sunset.

We are very excited, what about you? Join us on this adventure, while learning about the history of Porto!

Hey brainiacs,

Are you ready for a little friendly competition? ESN Porto is organizing a quiz night which will text your general knowledge. You will get to test yourself while making some new friends and annoying others with your know-it-all attitude.

The categories being tested will range from history, geography, arts, music, sports and many others. So are you the one that knows all about the globe, or are you the one that knows the most played song in 2010? Join your friends or just come by yourself and have fun while making new friends!

description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 20â‚¬, with our t-shirt included and it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. Hello!


Carnival is almost here and we've got big news for ya! Life is a Carnival, and you are about to experience it for real ;)


Do you know what Carnival means for other cultures?  It's a Western Christian festive season that occurs before the liturgical season of Lent. The main events typically occur during February or early March, during the period historically known as Shrovetide (or Pre-Lent). Carnival typically involves public celebrations, including events such as parades, public street parties and other entertainments,combining some elements of a circus.


Be ready to represent your Carnival! Don't waste any more time! Get your best costume, solo or in group, bring your friends and come have fun with us.


What: Carnival Dinner

When: Monday, 28th of February, 20h00

Where: Confeitaria ImpÃ©rio, near BolhÃ£o Market (here)

Join us in this night full of surprises that only have one purpose: make everything more colorful, brighter, and crazier! Your semester is just starting, so be prepared to make the best memories in Porto so far.

Hello beautiful people!

Have you been in the city for a few weeks and need to *finally* learn some of Portoâ€™s culture? Like tasting Porto Wine and seeing our beautiful city from its beautiful River? No worries! ESN Porto got you covered with the Boat Trip and Wine Cellars activity!

First, we will start with a nice and relaxing boat trip in the Douro river, where you will be able to see the beautiful Unesco World Heritage Sites that you have on both sides of the river. After that, we will visit a wine cellar where youâ€™ll learn about Porto wine, which we are sure you all are eager to taste, know how itâ€™s produced and what is the main difference from regular wines. In the end, the moment you were waiting for, you can taste it!

Are you ready to join us as we share with you a part of our culture?

name: [Waiting List] Surf Open Day - 5PM Class
description:
Surf Open Day February 20th 2022

To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an e-mail to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 20â‚¬, with our t-shirt included and it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. You must bring a photo of yourself (passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your ESNcard.

Hello sea lovers!

By now, you probably heard that one of the most beautiful things about Porto is its amazing beaches, with the ocean as the most epic landscape of all time. Now, we ask you: what if you could add this great view with an opportunity to do awesome physical activity?

We bring to you the Surf Open Day, on February 13th 2022, at one of our partners, Flower Power Surf School. This is an amazing opportunity to try one new sport, fall a lot of times and laugh at it, and take some nice pictures to your Instagram feed. How could you say â€œnoâ€, right?

We will divide you into small groups and you will have to choose the best time for you: 2 pm, 3 pm, 4 pm and 5 pm when registering on the website. (please be there 30min before your class). We will also ask you to pay a deposit of 10 euros that will be given back to you after you attend the class (you have to show up in order to have the deposit back).

Join us and start preparing for the Olympic Games in Paris 2024.

What: Surf Open Day 

When: Sunday, 20th of February 2022, 17h00

Where: Flower Power Surf School (map here)

Price: Free! (10â‚¬ deposit)

What to bring: your ESNcard, a water bottle, food, sunscreen, swimsuit, a towel, good mood, and your mask!

We care about you and your health. In order to be as responsible as we can be, ESN Porto will have the following security measures, which will be mandatory to both Erasmus and ESNers in order to attend the event:

  • Presenting a European digital certificate of vaccination, negative test or recovery. You can find all of the details here;
  • The use of masks is recommended in general but mandatory in closed spaces like buses or whenever the establishment obliges its use.
  • Social distancing must be respected (1,5m);
  • We reserve the right to forbid the participation in our events if the person presents at least one of the following symptoms (even if it is a paid event): coughing; temperature above 37,5ÂºC; shortness of breath;
  • The registration for the event is mandatory, for us to have control of the number of participants and by doing so it will be possible for ESN Porto to apply the security measures mentioned above.
  • In case you tested positive for COVID-19 until fifteen days after the event, we kindly ask you to inform us so we can proceed with our contingency plan.

We appreciate your understanding.

Notes:

There are no refunds available for this event.

You are automatically registered to this activity when you click "Buy", no need to go to the ESN Office.

Terrain: â¤ï¸ Red: Outdoors event in the sand and sea

description:

Hello sea lovers!

By now, you probably heard that one of the most beautiful things about Porto is its amazing beaches, with the ocean as the most epic landscape of all time. Now, we ask you: what if you could add this great view with an opportunity to do awesome physical activity?

We bring to you the Surf Open Day, on February 13th 2022, at one of our partners, Flower Power Surf School. This is an amazing opportunity to try one new sport, fall a lot of times and laugh at it, and take some nice pictures to your Instagram feed. How could you say â€œnoâ€, right?

We will divide you into small groups and you will have to choose the best time for you: 2 pm, 3 pm, 4 pm and 5 pm when registering on the website. (please be there 30min before your class). We will also ask you to pay a deposit of 10 euros that will be given back to you after you attend the class (you have to show up in order to have the deposit back).

Join us and start preparing for the Olympic Games in Paris 2024.

We bring to you the Surf Open Day, on February 13th 2022, at one of our partners, Flower Power Surf School. This is an amazing opportunity to try one new sport, fall a lot of times and laugh at it, and take some nice pictures to your Instagram feed. How could you say â€œnoâ€, right?

description:

It will cost you 20â‚¬, with our t-shirt included and it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. Hello there people!

Are you ready for an amazing trip to one of the most beautiful cities of Portugal? Well, this time we are going to take you to the Portuguese Venice and one of the most romantic Portuguese cities!

Surrounded by salt-flats, beaches, lagoons and incredible colourful little houses, here you will be able to enjoy the view next to the watercourse and discover the city on board of a typical boat called â€œMoliceiroâ€.

Then you will have the opportunity to learn how to make a traditional sweet from Portugal called Ovos-Moles, made with egg yolks and sugar, and the best part is: you can taste them afterwards!

To finish things off, we will take you around the cityâ€™s best spots and end the trip at a fishermanâ€™s village called â€œCosta Novaâ€ known for itâ€™s beautiful striped houses. If you are brave enough, you will be able to soak your feet in the ocean at the beach.

This is our program:

08h30: Meeting point at Reitoria (map here)

10h00: Arrival to Aveiro

10h30-12h00 - Boat trip/City Tour

12h00: Free time for lunch and visit Aveiro

14h00-16h00: Ovos Moles Workshop

16h30: Visit to Costa Nova Village and beach

18h30: Departure to Porto

  • The type of required test and certificate might vary according to the specific rules of each establishment and kind of event;
  • The use of masks is recommended in general but mandatory in closed spaces like buses or whenever the establishment obliges its use.

Sports is one of the things that unite us all as a universal language! Amateur or professional, the important thing is to have fun in what you do!

By now, we already know that you tried to surf, play volleyball and many other sports, but... have you ever tried Boccia? Hmm, no?

So this is the perfect opportunity to try and learn with the best!

Boccia is an international modality meant for people with disabilities and we want to invite you to play with the FC Porto Boccia team! The only skill needed is the willingness to have fun among brilliant players!

European medalists included! How cool is this?!

name: Farewell Dinner
description:
Hello dearest people and by now family,

Christmas is arriving, the New Year is almost here, and the end of the semester, closer and closer. By now, you've experienced the most magical and beatiful things that Porto has to offer, and we hope you don't want to go back home.

This amazing chapter of your life is on it's last moments,  but many memories still can, and will, be written, next to all the activities, parties, dinners and trips that you've experienced since you arrived in Porto. 

We love to have you here and we invite you to our greatest Farewell Dinner. Let us share the table one last time, and create the moments we want to remember when we are all old grandparents.

We might have some surprises prepared for you... just bring an old white t-shirt eheh

name: Quiz Without Borders
description:
Hey, everyone!

Did you know that December 5th is International Volunteering Day? We thought there was no better way to celebrate it than by teaming up with another amazing volunteer organisation to create an awesome event for you!

Together with HuBB - Humans Before Borders (a platform for action against inhumane and illegal treatment of migrants and refugees), we bring you the opportunity to have an informal and open dialogue about Human Rights and refugees with locals and other Erasmus. All this while playing a quiz game to test your knowledge - you can have fun AND learn while you're at it!

Join us at ESPIGA, a creative community bar/gallery, known for its events for travellers (and don't tell anyone, but they will have drinks and snacks available for us! We all know that's the real reason why we create these events, right?!). Come, exchange views with people from the most diverse backgrounds and whose enriching knowledge will definitely bring your perception to another level... and, if your team is the victorious, you'll also be winning some awesome prizes! Are you actually going to miss it?!

name: Trip Ã“bidos - Christmas Village
description:
Hey there, travelers,

As you know very well, Christmas is almost here! And with this in mind, we've prepared an amazing trip to Ã“bidos and its Christmas village!!

We will start our trip by visiting the Aljubarrota Monastery which is one of the most beautiful works of Portuguese and European architecture! It was built to fulfill a promise made by King D. JoÃ£o I, in gratitude for the victory in Aljubarrota in 1385, which secured his kingdom and ensured Portugal's independence. Obviously, and after you know everything, we'll take you to Aljubarrota, where the battle took place!

After lunch, we will go to the Christmas village in Ã“bidos and you will be able to let your inner child be free in that magical place! One of those hidden gems in Portugal, this quaint village, medieval in style and charming in personality, will be the delight of those keen to explore ancient Portugal. From a giant wheel, an ice-skating rink to a big Christmas Tree and a nativity scene, you can have it all!

Excited yet? Check out our program:07:00 - Meeting point at Reitoria

name: Young, abroadâ€¦ and looking after your well-being?
briefDescription: Online roundtable on the impact of youth mobility on individuals
description:
While living abroad, with the big changes, new routines, the pressure to enjoy, mixed with homesickness and expectations, it is easy to forget to take the time to look after ourselves. Thus, ESN Porto and Euro Youth Mental Health, the only European-wide organisation dedicated to improving the mental health support of young people, teamed up to create a safe space to have an honest conversation about how "the best time of your life" can be hard too.

Join us in this informal roundtable online where a former Erasmus student, a European Solidarity Corps volunteer, and a young professional in different countries will briefly share their joys and struggles, and best advice. Then, you will have the chance to listen and share experiences, fears, expectations, motivations, and your own tips with others in smaller groups facilitated by volunteers of Euro Youth Mental Health. Finally, a professional will give you some information and resources to look after your well-being while abroad and make the best of your current and future experiences.

More than ever, it is time to deconstruct stereotypes and create a debate about the (in)perfection surrounding Erasmus and living abroad.  Guess what? Itâ€™s okay not to be okay, and it is okay to ask for help!

You are welcome to join us if you are a young person from any country who is currently living abroad; has lived in a different country; is considering/planning an international experience in the future. All you have to do is sign-up HERE to secure your spot. You will receive an email confirming your registration.

We hope to see you there!


What: â€œYoung, abroadâ€¦ and looking after your well being?"
When: Monday, 29 November 2021, 19h (PT time); 20h CET

Where: Online, through Zoom - As this can be a sensitive topic, you can protect your identity by changing your name and keeping your camera off.

Price: Free!

What to bring: Just register HERE and be available for an open and interesting conversation.

name: Trip to FÃ¡tima & Tomar
description:
âš ï¸ The spots with UP discount will be sold exclusively at the office âš ï¸


Hello brave travellers!

By now, you may think that you have seen the best that Portugal has to offer. You couldnâ€™t be more far from the truth! Believe in us, you may have already visited some places, but we are sure you havenâ€™t gone deep enough, for there are still hidden gems, hidden places of exceptional beauty, waiting for you to unearth them.

As the starting point of this awesome trip, we would like to take you to Tomar, considered a World Heritage by UNESCO. There, the imposing Convent of Christ stands, former stronghold of one of the most powerful orders of knights in Christendom, the Knights Templar! For those into old history, we have a special treat prepared for you, as you explore this ancient place of might and valor.

After the visit to the convent, we are taking you into the depths of the earth, where no sunlight penetrates: the caves of Mira de Aire. This cave system is the biggest in Portugal, reaching 600 meters in depth. Hope you are feeling adventurous.

After getting an insane amount of nice pictures for your Instagram, we will end our trip with a visit to FÃ¡tima, a city that is known for its religious symbolism. There you will get the chance to see one of the most magnificent and awe-inspiring shrines in Christendom, blessed by none other than Pope John Paul II. It is told that in 1916, the blessed Virgin Mary chose to appear before three children! The shrine was later built as a tribute to our lady.

So, if youâ€™re feeling adventurous, run to the office to buy your ticket and come with us, letâ€™s unravel all these old mysteries and legends!

Program

07h00 - Meeting point in Reitoria

10h00 - Arrival to Tomar

10h30 - Visit to the Convent of Christ

12h30 - Free time for lunch

14h30 - Visit to "Grutas de Mira de Aire"

16h30 - Visit to "SantuÃ¡rio de FÃ¡tima"

19h00 - Departure to Porto

name: Trip to Coimbra
description:
Hi there fellow travellers!

This time we are taking you to the so called â€œCity of Studentsâ€! Are you ready to explore the most traditional and academic Portuguese city?

Coimbra is located in the Center of Portugal and itâ€™s one of the most ancient cities of the country, where the oldest university of Portugal and one of the oldest in Europe is situated - Universidade de Coimbra, founded 728 years ago. It is said that LuÃ­s Vaz de CamÃµes, Portugalâ€™s great national poet, studied at the University of Coimbra, nonetheless it was never proved. Coimbra is also characterized by its Fado (Fado de Coimbra) that was adopted by students at the University of Coimbra and it is usually considered the typical music of Coimbra itself.

We still haven't convinced you to come? Check out our program and discover everything we are going to do in one of the most iconic cities in Portugal

name: Trip to S. Martinho Penafiel
description:
Hello guys,

Itâ€™s Autumn time and that means it's time for Magusto!!

Every year, this time of the year, Portuguese people come together to eat castanhas assadas (roasted chestnuts) and drink the new wine of this yearâ€™s harvest.

And this is what this trip is all about! Letâ€™s celebrate this time of the year, travelling to one of the most famous Magusto in Portugal, the celebration of S. Martinho, in Penafiel.

S. Martinho is a celebration in honour of Saint Martin that became a Saint for a notable act, when he had cut his cloak in half to share with a beggar during a snowstorm, to save him from the cold. The legend said that the snowstorm stopped and the sun rose. Thatâ€™s why in November, when itâ€™s sunny, we call it VerÃ£o de S. Martinho (Saint Martin summer).

Join us in one of the most famous Portuguese tradicional holidays and discover good food, wine and also have fun with the people, music and carnival rides.

We will first stop at the closest preserved village near Porto, the Aldeia de Quintandona. Made entirely of schist, you will discover the wonders of a Portuguese little village.

name: Cultural Sunday @PlanetÃ¡rio
description:
Hello, you astronauts!

If you love stargazing, eclipses, energy, universe and astronomy, this one's for you!

Did you know that the atomic elements come from the stars? - this literally means that you are a star child! Or that blackholes' gravity force is so strong that not even light itself can escape its gravitational pull? You can learn this and much more by joining ESN Porto at PlanetÃ¡rio do Porto for an activity which will send you flying into orbit without ever leaving the ground!

Scientists estimate there are 1 billion trillion stars in the observable universe AKA 1.000.000.000.000.000.000.000 stars (yes! this number is correct). We orbit one of those: our beloved star, the Sun, which is 8 light-minutes away from the Earth (or roughly 150.000.000 km). But we at ESN Porto would argue that you are the brightest star of them all

So come join us in exploring the world's newest frontier, as we participate not in a space race - even though we would definitely win! - but in the best space expedition since a renowned band Counted Stars a few years ago - OK, this part was kind of tacky, we admit it. But we promise the event will be awesome! And don't forget! "Per aspera ad astra."

name: "Dancing your way to well-being" - Dance Workshop and Vegan Food
description:
Hello, dear Friends,

We know that moving abroad, as exciting as it is, changes your habits and routines, and sometimes this new lifestyle can be a source of distress, both physically and emotionally. Trying all these delicious new foods, not working out as much as we should and all the nights out can also take a toll on our bodies and minds and it can be hard to feel connected to our true selves by the end of the day.

But donâ€™t worryâ€¦we've got you covered! We have prepared an evening full of joy and reconnection for you! It is going to be a dance class with an open perspective on movement and expression, where you will rewire right back and shake all the bad energy away! There is no better way to boost your mood than through dancing, right?

After this, we will have the opportunity to gather and socialize with an amazing vegan snack that our mouths and bodies will only thank us for!

Are you going to join us and dance your way to well-being?

Classified as World Heritage by UNESCO since 2001, the historical center is a mandatory visit for anyone who wants to know Portugal and you will have the opportunity to do so, together with that weâ€™ll also visit two very important monuments, the castle (Castelo de GuimarÃ£es) and the palace, PaÃ§o dos Duques. name: Tascas Route
description:
Hello foodies,

We bet that, by now, you have already heard about our famous Tascas and if you havenâ€™t, then get ready to uncover one of the best secrets Portugal has to offer! 
"What are Â«TascasÂ»?", you may askâ€¦Basically, they are very traditional and familial restaurants around the city that serve cheap, tasty, and typical food and drinks. They are those little places around you that you probably didn't even notice! And since you probably never actually got to try them out, we want to give you the best Tascas experience!


They are where the best and most typical food can be tasted and where you can find any typical Portuguese eating a delicious cachorrinho or enjoying a glass of wine with a codfish cake we call bolinho de bacalhau.


If you think you were born too late to explore the world and too early to explore the universe, this Tascas Route will change your mind because, we assure you, you were born at the right time to explore our delicious typical food! In true Portuguese fashion, come and join us in this amazing food experience and talk, eat, drink and have fun because, as we bet you know, the best stories all start with some delicious food and a glass of beer in front of you!

name: Climbing to ArrÃ¡bida Bridge
description:
Hello brave climbers,

Adrenalin, adventure and big excitement are coming upâ€¦ Are you afraid of heights? Join us in this adventure and letâ€™s CLIMB one of the most iconic buildings in Porto! At the top, 65 meters above the river, you will find a quiet and relaxing place to enjoy unique views.

In 1963, the ArrÃ¡bida Bridge was the largest concrete arch in the world. And since 2016, the arch became the only one in Europe that is open to visitors. ESN Porto is offering you a unique opportunity to have access to a building that has been closed to the public for 53 years. Come with us and enjoy this adventure!

name: Trip to Sintra
description:
Once upon a time, princes and princesses found a beautiful land to conquer. It was the charming village of Sintra, and this is the next destination we are bringing you to: In this trip we give you the opportunity to spend some time in a palace like the ones you only see at movies, fall in love in the most romantic gardens youâ€™ll ever see and run out of breath with natural landscape, and as we couldnâ€™t miss, we will also meet the ocean (of course, we are in Portugal) in Cabo da Roca which is known as the place â€œWhere the land ends and the sea begins.â€ Sounds good, doesnâ€™t it? But we still have moreâ€¦ We are going to walk along the wonderful beaches of our coast and give you a little taste of our capital city: Lisbon!

Youâ€™ll get the chance to visit one of the 7 wonders of Portugal, PalÃ¡cio da Pena, and Quinta da Regaleira, a property classified as world heritage by UNESCO and known for the beautiful garden and the amazing architecture of the 20th century. Between rocks and hills, youâ€™ll find Castelo dos Mouros that has a stunning view of Sintra and finally, come see the Boca do Inferno which is an unique sea-arch and cliff formation close to the town of Cascais with violent winter storms where  water explodes upwards similar to an erupting volcano â€“ hence the overdramatic name.

What are you waiting for? Get your tickets and start living this fairytale! ğŸ˜

briefDescription: But where does that good wine come from?
description:
Hello there, fellow wanderer!

Are you looking for an adventure? We got you covered! We will take you to the most wonderful river in the country so that you can explore and admire its surroundings. This trip will also give you an opportunity to check some amazing views that our Douro river has to offer us!

Let us guess: you love Porto Wine and you wonder "Where does that good wine come from?" That's why, during the morning, we'll visit one of the most important Port Wine vineyards, so get ready to do some wine tasting! Later, during the afternoon, we'll check out the most comprehensive clock ever made and enjoy a beautiful cruise through PinhÃ£o and discover a part of the Douro River that is hidden from the roads. Sounds great, right?

So hop into this van and join us in this wonderful adventure full of wonderful landscapes! We promise you that the best is at the end, where we'll recharge our energies by watching a sunset with (yet another) marvellous view!


This is a trip you surely will not want to miss!

description:
To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 15â‚¬, with our t-shirt included and it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. Hello friends!

Are you ready to go on a 3 days adventure?

This time, we are taking you to the capital, one of the world's greatest historical cities! Lisbonâ€™s amazing sights, original street art and delicious traditional food are waiting for you!

Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to visit some of the most iconic monuments and get lost in the cityâ€™s picturesque narrow streets during the day! After that, we will have as much fun as COVID-19 let us!!!

During these 3 days, we are going to visit some places that will take your breath away, like Terreiro do PaÃ§o, which is one of the most majestic squares in Lisbon. It was once a palace but got almost completely destroyed after the 1755 earthquake. Castelo de SÃ£o Jorge, an emblematic landmark where you will have an amazing view of the city, Rio Tejo and the Atlantic Ocean. You will also spot other fantastic places like Rossio square, Restauradores square, Rua Augusta and its arch, Pink Street, etc.

We couldnâ€™t leave without passing by JerÃ³nimos Monastery, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a 16th-century symbol of the wealth of the Age of Discovery, followed by BelÃ©m, which is the home of the BelÃ©m Tower, another World Heritage site, and probably the most important monument in Lisbon. Itâ€™s a 16th-century fortress where you can climb the spiral staircase up to the terrace, only to find a breathtaking panorama of the river.

And of course, you couldnâ€™t go home without trying the traditional PASTEL DE BELÃ‰M - the best in the country! At the end of the journey, weâ€™ll visit the National Pantheon, the house of the tombs of Portugalâ€™s major historic celebrities.

name: Trip to Aveiro
description:
Trip to Aveiro

26th of September of 2021

To participate in ESN activities, you must buy an ESNcard here, after registering you will get an email to proceed with the payment. It will cost you 15â‚¬, with our t-shirt included and it is valid for one year. Our ESNcard allows you to benefit from lots of national and international discounts with our partners. You must bring a photo of yourself (passport type) when you come to the office to pick up your ESNcard.

Hello there people!

After so many months sitting on the sofa, what better way to start the year than to get to know more about Portugal?

Well, this time we are going to take you to the Portuguese Venice and one of the most romantic cities of our country!

Surrounded by salt-flats, beaches, lagoons and incredibly colourful little houses, here you will be able to enjoy the view next to the watercourse and discover the city on board of a typical boat called â€œMoliceiroâ€.

You will have the opportunity to taste the traditional sweet from Portugal called Ovos-Moles, made with egg yolks and sugar!

To finish things off, we will take you around the cityâ€™s best spots and end the trip at a fishermanâ€™s village called â€œCosta Novaâ€ known for itâ€™s beautiful striped houses. If you are brave enough, you will be able to soak your feet in the ocean at the beach.

This is our program:

08h00: Meeting point at Reitoria

10h00: Arrival in Aveiro

10h30 - 12h30: City Tour/Boat trip

12h30: Free Time for lunch and visit Aveiro

16h00: Visit to Costa Nova village

18h00: Departure to Porto

What: Trip to Aveiro

When: Sunday, 26th of September

Meeting Point: Reitoria (map here) @ 8h00

Price: 20 â‚¬

What is included:

  • Bus trip
  • Boat trip
  • City Tour
  • Ovos moles to taste

What to bring: Your ESNcard; Your Mask; Comfortable shoes; Good mood :)

On Saturday 25th, join us and our partner, Flower Power Surf School and come hit the waves. We will have everything planned for a great lesson with lots of fun and some falls. Hello dear Erasmus!

name: [FULL] Portuguese Night
description:
Got your ESNcard and unsure whatâ€™s next? Feeling like youâ€™re missing out on all the action? ğŸ‰ No worries, weâ€™ve got just the thing for you: Portuguese Night is here! âœ¨ 

Whatâ€™s Portuguese Night all about?
Itâ€™s your gateway to experiencing Porto the way locals do, immersed in our vibrant culture, music, and traditions. ğŸ¶ Weâ€™re offering a night filled with everything that makes Portugal special, and the best part? Itâ€™s only 2â‚¬! ğŸ™Œ

  • Enjoy delicious local bites, featuring beloved finger foods made just like our grandmothers used to prepare.
  • Soak up the perfect Erasmus vibe as you mingle with fellow international students, with a touch of Portuguese flavor.
  • And donâ€™t forget, our friendly ESN volunteers will be there to welcome you and make this night the highlight of your Welcome Month!

Mark your calendars! ğŸ‰

Get ready for a night of fun, music, and great company! âœ¨

name: [CANCELLED] Trip to Coimbra
description:
Hello everyone,

Do you like history? Do you love partying and studentsâ€™ academic traditions?  If so, this trip is going to be all you have been waiting for this semester, and more!

This amazing trip will start with RuÃ­nas de Conimbriga, one of the oldest, biggest and most important archeology traces in Portugal. It used to be a city during the Roman Empire. Letâ€™s dig into some ruins and resurrect B.C. memories.

About PaÃ§o das Escolas, we are talking about UNESCO World Heritage. It was the Royal Square since D. Afonso Henriques Kingdom, first king of Portugal in 1140 (oof thatâ€™s a lot of years ago). The Biblioteca  Joanina is located at PaÃ§o das Escolas and it is a Baroque style Library, known as one of the biggest and most original European Baroque librabries!

Now the big mysterious partâ€¦ Cortejo de Coimbra! We donâ€™t want to give you spoilers, but letâ€™s just say when Coimbra students go for it, they go for it all the way! Basically floats full of beer wonâ€™t be a thing missing. This Parade (Cortejo), marks the goodbyes for the seniors leaving college, and for the freshmen, it is about the integration on the academic life. It is a fun and unique experience, and a great way for you to understand how we really value and feel towards the academic life and traditions (yeah we are kinda extra regarding this, we already know).

Want to have an amazing Erasmus experience and absorb as much as possible of our University culture? Check the program below!

  • Some money, in case you plan on having lunch or dinner in a nearby restaurant, otherwise bring your own food
  • Toiletries, clothes and utilities to spend the night
  • A great mood!

name: [CANCELLED] Erasmus Treasure Hunt Tomar
description:
Hello brave travelers!

By now, you may think that you have seen the best that Portugal has to offer. You couldnâ€™t be farther from the truth! Believe in us, you may have already visited some places, but we are sure you havenâ€™t gone deep enough, for there are still hidden gems, hidden places of exceptional beauty, waiting for you to unearth them.

On this 2 days trip, we will take to Tomar, considered a World Heritage by UNESCO. There, the imposing Convent of Christ stands, former stronghold of one of the most powerful orders of knights in Christendom, the Knights Templar! Afterward, you will explore this wonderful templar city by participating in an amazing Erasmus Treasure Hunt organized by our fellow section ESN Tomar! And of course, for dinner you will have a truly medieval experience at Taverna Antiqua!

On the following day, you will explore the city of Leiria and its beautiful Castle! Additionally, there will also be the Leiria Fair, where you can experience a traditional Portuguese fest with good food and carnival rides!

So, if youâ€™re feeling adventurous, join us on this unique trip and letâ€™s unravel all these old mysteries and legends!

name: Surf Course - 5 classes
description:
Aloha!

So you have been seeing some surfers having a blast down in Matosinhos and you think you also want to try it? We have great news! 

Our surf courses offer you the opportunity to try exactly that! Expert or beginner, this is right up every beach or surf loverâ€™s alley! 

Founded in 2005, Flower Power Surf School is in its essence a club of friends that shared the same passion and ideals. Specialized in surfing, they have the know-how, skill, experience and resources to make Flower Power Surf School an exciting place for Erasmus students. 

What are you waiting for?  


Terms and conditions:

  • Classes take place in Matosinhos, at FlowerPower Surf School;
  • Teachers have qualifications and ample experience as surf trainers;
  • Price includes all the material you need during the classes (board and suit) and personal insurance;
  • The course lasts 3 months from the time of purchase;
  • Classes last around 2h and there are classes every day at 11am and 3pm;
  • Each class has a limit of participants which are defined by order of registration;
  • The course is personal and non-transferable;
  • Thereâ€™s a place to change clothes and get equipped right by the beach - you just need to bring a towel;
  • Whenever you have some problems or accidents always talk to your professor so he can always be aware of the situation;  


Your surf friends,

ESN Porto
